title: How to Find Your Soulmate Through Astrology

steps.title: Figure out the time, date, and year you were born.
steps.content: Figure out the time, date, and year you were born. These specific details are all you will need to create a natal chart for yourself. If you aren’t sure of the specifics, try to track down your birth certificate—it’s super important that your info is accurate! [1] X Research source If you’re going to be comparing your chart to someone else’s (like your partner or your crush), get their info as well. That way, you can make them an accurate chart. Love astrology? Take this quiz to discover your soulmate's sign.

steps.title: Plug in your information into a natal chart website.
steps.content: Plug in your information into a natal chart website. There are tons of free websites you can use by doing a simple Google search. Once you enter your information, you’ll be able to see your own natal chart, which will look like a circle. [2] X Research source Finding your natal chart is the first step toward finding your soulmate! Once you have your chart in front of you, you can look at specific areas to find out who you’re most compatible with.

steps.title: Check out your seventh house, Mars and Venus, and your north nodes.
steps.content: Check out your seventh house, Mars and Venus, and your north nodes. All 3 of these components can help you figure out who you’re most compatible with and who your soulmate might be. Pay special attention to these on your natal chart, and keep reading to learn how you can use them to find your soulmate!

steps.title: Check out your rising sun sign, or your seventh house.
steps.content: Check out your rising sun sign, or your seventh house. Your rising sun sign, also called your ascendant or the seventh house , is usually on the left side of your natal chart. It will contain the symbol of your rising sign, which may be any of the zodiac signs. Once you figure out your own rising sign , you can use it to learn more about who you might fall in love with. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Research the sign that’s opposite your seventh house.
steps.content: Research the sign that’s opposite your seventh house. The sign that’s opposite your own rising sign is the one you’re most compatible with. For instance, if your rising sign is Pisces, then you’re most compatible with Virgos. Opposites attract, and your natal chart will definitely reflect that. [4] X Research source Other opposite signs include: Aries and Libra Taurus and Scorpio Gemini and Sagittarius Cancer and Capricorn Leo and Aquarius Virgo and Pisces

steps.title: Look for a partner whose sign is opposite to yours.
steps.content: Look for a partner whose sign is opposite to yours. Once you find out who your opposite sign is, you can try finding your soulmate that way! As you search for a partner, try to look for someone with the opposite sign as you. Chances are, you’ll be more compatible with them than any of the other zodiac signs out there.

steps.title: Look at the degree of Mars and Venus in your chart.
steps.content: Look at the degree of Mars and Venus in your chart. Venus tells you how you’ll be most happy, while Mars explains who you’ll be most sexually compatible with. On the bottom of your natal chart, you’ll find a key that explains the degree of Mars and Venus in your chart. Check out those numbers and remember them so you can compare them. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Compare the degree in another person’s chart.
steps.content: Compare the degree in another person’s chart. If you and your partner are compatible, your Mars and Venus will be within 10 or so degrees of each other. For instance, if your Mars is 15 degrees, your partner’s should hopefully be from 10 degrees to 20 degrees.

steps.title: Look for a partner whose degree of Mars and Venus is closest to yours.
steps.content: Look for a partner whose degree of Mars and Venus is closest to yours. The closer the degrees are in your charts, the more likely it is that you will find love with this person. As you look for a date, ask to see their natal chart and then compare your Mars and Venus degrees. Chances are, the person you end up with will have their Mars and Venus very close to yours.

steps.title: Look up your north node dates.
steps.content: Look up your north node dates. The north node is when the moon moves past the ecliptic (Earth’s orbit in relation to the sky) as it travels around the hemisphere. When your north node awakens, it usually means that you’ve met someone important in your life. For your exact north node dates, use an online calculator. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Compare your north node dates to someone else's dates.
steps.content: Compare your north node dates to someone else's dates. The closer they are together, the more likely it is that you two already have a connection. Many astrologers believe that when you share the same nodes as someone else, you have an inherent spiritual connection with them. [7] X Research source You’ll most likely share the same nodes as someone if their birthday is near yours or if they are exactly 9 to 10 years older or younger than you.
